Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the consequences of not forwarding the message, stating that accounts will be deemed "invalid" and deleted within 48 hours, and users will be charged Rs 499 to reuse the services.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the central government has made WhatsApp unavailable between 11:30 pm and 6 am, or that forwarding the message will make a user an "active" WhatsApp user.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that forwarding the message to contacts will prevent the account from being deemed "invalid" or deleted, and that it will grant access to a new version of the app with a blue logo.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that WhatsApp will be chargeable at 0.01€ per message, as stated in the message.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the message being circulated, such as a hoax or misinformation, rather than an official declaration by the central government.
